doc.previous: The Krull dimension of a commutative ring R is the supremum of the lengths n of all the increasing chains of prime ideals . For example, the polynomial ring over a field k has dimension n. The fundamental theorem in the dimension theory states the following numbers coincide for a noetherian local ring :[4]
doc.after: where is the height of . It is a deep theorem of Ratliff that the converse is also true.[5]
